avalancheActivity.comment:
Snow cover is mostly stable. With sunny weather and a relatively warm air mass at high altitudes, some small avalanches of wet snow may still spontaneously occur during the day on steep slopes, but avalanches are unlikely in most areas.
In arid areas above the tree line, weak layers are present in the snow cover. In a few places, a small, clustered avalanche may be triggered under higher loads.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In sunny weather, a small avalanche of packed snow can still occur on steep slopes during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow cover has already largely melted and stabilised, and a lot of snow has melted on the slopes. In sunny weather, the crust on the slopes strengthens and softens during the day. In the shadier and sheltered areas, especially in the high mountains, the snow cover remains soft and dry. In arid areas, weak layers may be present in the snow cover.

tendency.highlights: Sunny weather will continue at the weekend, with some clouds, especially on Saturday. Temperatures will strengthen on Saturday and weaken again on Sunday. Winds will be light. During the day, the snow cover will become heavier and less stable on the slopes, while the snow on the slopes will melt and melt slowly.

weatherForecast.comment: Mostly clear with a few clouds. The air will be dry, with zero isotherm at an altitude of around 2700 m. There will be light winds from caye directions.
